testcase.name: testReverseGameOver

failure.message:
org.scalatest.exceptions.TestFailedException: didPass was false Hint: Reversing from a game over state should immediately give the last non game over state -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This is what went wrong:
step=0, rand=2, actions=<> Want | Got ✓ ------------- OO>.. | OO>.. A.... | A....
step=1, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✓ ------------- .OO>. | .OO>. A.... | A....
step=2, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✓ ------------- ..OO> | ..OO> A.... | A....
step=3, rand=2, actions=<ChangeDir(North()), Step> Want | Got ✓ ------------- ...OO | ...OO A...^ | A...^
step=4, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✓ ------------------------------------- GameOverDisplay() | GameOverDisplay()
step=5, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✓ ------------------------------------- GameOverDisplay() | GameOverDisplay()
step=6, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✓ ------------------------------------- GameOverDisplay() | GameOverDisplay()
step=7, rand=2, actions=<ReverseGame(true), Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------------------- ...OO | GameOverDisplay() A...^ |
step=8, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------------------- ..OO> | GameOverDisplay() A.... |
step=9, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------------------- .OO>. | GameOverDisplay() A.... |
step=10, rand=2, actions=<Step> Want | Got ✗ ------------------------- OO>.. | GameOverDisplay() A.... |
